description: Irwin lists this stop with the following description: A Chorus Reed of 16' manual pitch, and 32' pedal pitch, with moderately loud, brass-like tone similar to a more intense form of the Fagottone, capable of supporting Reeds from f to ff. Bonavia-Hunt mentions this stop as being a name for a 32' pedal Bombarde.
examplesDescription: Contra Bombardon 32', Pedal; Auditorium, Ocean Grove, New Jersey, USA; Hope-Jones 1908. (The same division also contains a Contra Bombarde 32'.)
